notes: Most beginner-friendly snake; docile and rarely bite
Excellent feeders; readily eat frozen-thawed mice/rats
Numerous color morphs available (red, orange, yellow, etc.)
Very hardy and forgiving of minor care lapses
Escape artists - ensure secure, escape-proof enclosure

warnings.message: Secure enclosure is essential. Corn snakes are incredible escape artists and will exploit any gap. Check locks and seals regularly.
Feed frozen-thawed prey only (never live). Live prey can injure or kill your snake. Thaw in warm water before feeding.
Juvenile corn snakes need hides and climbing branches. As they grow (2-3 feet), provide larger hiding spots.
Corn snakes are the #1 recommended snake for beginners. Forgiving, hardy, and manageable size make them ideal first reptiles.
